job.title: HR Data Analyst
job.industry: Financial Services,Health, Wellness and Fitness,Hospital & Health Care
job.description:
About Centria Healthcare
Founded in 2009 and headquartered in Farmington Hills, Michigan, Centria Healthcare is a leading provider of home-based catastrophic injury and rehabilitation care, private duty nursing, and supportive living services. Centria Healthcare Autism Services is the largest provider of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) across the state of Michigan, with services in other states.
Position Overview
The HR Analyst is responsible for partnering with leaders and human resources partners to help drive employee engagement and retention through reporting and analytics. The HR Analyst will use industry best practices and innovations to support the engagement efforts across the organization.
Responsibilities
The ideal candidate must be able to perform the following essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodations.
Responsible for supporting the execution of the employee engagement strategy through qualitative and quantitative research and reporting
Analyzes and recognizes patterns in employee data to help leaders identify risks and opportunities
Identify trends and patterns through the analysis of survey data
Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance employee engagement across Centria
Identify issues and trends within written feedback/comments by reviewing and categorizing feedback by topic, sentiment, etc.
Constructs concise presentations and/or reporting, including tracking of employee engagement progress
Collaborate with the human resources on the interpretation and analysis of people data to improve engagement and performance
Research industry standards relative to healthcare and conduct/report on benchmarks, best practices, and trends in employee engagement for remote and internal team members
Work to enhance and create opportunities based upon analytics to continuously improve employee satisfaction, engagement and engagement
Build relationships and collaborate across the teams to provide high levels of internal customer service
Maintain a high level of confidentiality related to engagement reports, employee feedback, management performance and action plans
Commencement and/or commencement related activities may be required
Learn new software and assist with implementation of a new survey software system
Create and track KPIs relative to human capital
Automate current analytic processes using forms and/or macro’s to efficiently process data
Assist with ad hoc analysis requests
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills, Qualifications, And Knowledge
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field
At least one year of experience in an analyst capacity, human resources or related field
Experience with qualitative and quantitative data analysis
Ability to extract, organize and analyze data sets
Strong research and analytical skills and the ability to visually present data in a consumable format
Preferred Qualifications
Expert level Excel skills and strong knowledge of Word and PowerPoint
Knowledge of and experience with Engagement software system(s)
Ability to utilize Power BI for data visualization and dashboards
Understanding of statistical modeling (e.g., Pearson’s Correlation Coefficient)
Experience with predictive analytics relative to human capital
Centria’s office hours are Monday through Friday from 8:30am-6:00pm. Additional time may be required to complete above work or meet company objectives.
Physical Requirements
While performing the duties of this job, physical requirements such as bending, reaching and lifting of up to 50 pounds may be required. This role will require sitting a majority of the day as well as walking as standing when needed. This role will require close visual activity on multiple computer screens or monitors and the ability to analyze data and figures on a screen.
